snippet: In recent years Spain’s autonomous regions built lavish projects, including a mega-movie studio in Valencia, with tax dollars. Now Valencia must explain how it will recoup taxpayers’ money.
abstract: European Union authorities issue an ultimatum to the regional government of Valencia to explain how it intends to recover $325 million in taxpayers' money improperly spent on its state-of-the-art movie studio; Spain's Prime Min Mariano Rajoy blames the country's overspending regions for much of its recent fiscal problems and, as a result, set strict 2012 budget targets and passed legislation levying fines on regions that fail to meet the goals.

byline.original: By DOREEN CARVAJAL and RAPHAEL MINDER

lead_paragraph: In recent years Spain’s autonomous regions built lavish projects, including a mega-movie studio in Valencia, with tax dollars. Now Valencia must explain how it will recoup taxpayers’ money.

headline.seo: In Spain, Publicly Financed Projects Founder
headline.main: First a Building Spree, Now the Ax Is Falling
headline.print_headline: First a Building Spree, Now the Ax Is Falling
